# API Reference for cdktf.IResolveContext

   IResolveContext <a name="IResolveContext" id="cdktf.IResolveContext"></a>
  
  - *Implemented By:* <a href="#cdktf.IResolveContext">IResolveContext</a>
  
  Current resolution context for tokens.
  
  # Methods <a name="Methods" id="Methods"></a>
  
  | **Name** | **Description** |
  | --- | --- |
  | <code><a href="#cdktf.IResolveContext.registerPostProcessor">RegisterPostProcessor</a></code> | Use this postprocessor after the entire token structure has been resolved. |
  | <code><a href="#cdktf.IResolveContext.resolve">Resolve</a></code> | Resolve an inner object. |
  
  ---
  
  ## `RegisterPostProcessor` <a name="RegisterPostProcessor" id="cdktf.IResolveContext.registerPostProcessor"></a>
  
  ```go
  func RegisterPostProcessor(postProcessor IPostProcessor)
  ```
  
  Use this postprocessor after the entire token structure has been resolved.
  
  ### `postProcessor`<sup>Required</sup> <a name="postProcessor" id="cdktf.IResolveContext.registerPostProcessor.parameter.postProcessor"></a>
  
  - *Type:* <a href="#cdktf.IPostProcessor">IPostProcessor</a>
  
  ---
  
  ## `Resolve` <a name="Resolve" id="cdktf.IResolveContext.resolve"></a>
  
  ```go
  func Resolve(x interface{}) interface{}
  ```
  
  Resolve an inner object.
  
  ### `x`<sup>Required</sup> <a name="x" id="cdktf.IResolveContext.resolve.parameter.x"></a>
  
  - *Type:* interface{}
  
  ---
  
  # Properties <a name="Properties" id="Properties"></a>
  
  | **Name** | **Type** | **Description** |
  | --- | --- | --- |
  | <code><a href="#cdktf.IResolveContext.property.preparing">Preparing</a></code> | <code>*bool</code> | True when we are still preparing, false if we're rendering the final output. |
  | <code><a href="#cdktf.IResolveContext.property.scope">Scope</a></code> | <code>github.com/aws/constructs-go/constructs/v10.IConstruct</code> | The scope from which resolution has been initiated. |
  | <code><a href="#cdktf.IResolveContext.property.iteratorContext">IteratorContext</a></code> | <code>*string</code> | TerraformIterators can be passed for block attributes and normal list attributes both require different handling when the iterable variable is accessed e.g. a dynamic block needs each.key while a for expression just needs key. |
  | <code><a href="#cdktf.IResolveContext.property.suppressBraces">SuppressBraces</a></code> | <code>*bool</code> | True when ${} should be ommitted (because already inside them), false otherwise. |
  
  ---
  
  ## `Preparing`<sup>Required</sup> <a name="Preparing" id="cdktf.IResolveContext.property.preparing"></a>
  
  ```go
  func Preparing() *bool
  ```
  
  - *Type:* *bool
  
  True when we are still preparing, false if we're rendering the final output.
  
  ---
  
  ## `Scope`<sup>Required</sup> <a name="Scope" id="cdktf.IResolveContext.property.scope"></a>
  
  ```go
  func Scope() IConstruct
  ```
  
  - *Type:* github.com/aws/constructs-go/constructs/v10.IConstruct
  
  The scope from which resolution has been initiated.
  
  ---
  
  ## `IteratorContext`<sup>Optional</sup> <a name="IteratorContext" id="cdktf.IResolveContext.property.iteratorContext"></a>
  
  ```go
  func IteratorContext() *string
  ```
  
  - *Type:* *string
  
  TerraformIterators can be passed for block attributes and normal list attributes both require different handling when the iterable variable is accessed e.g. a dynamic block needs each.key while a for expression just needs key.
  
  ---
  
  ## `SuppressBraces`<sup>Optional</sup> <a name="SuppressBraces" id="cdktf.IResolveContext.property.suppressBraces"></a>
  
  ```go
  func SuppressBraces() *bool
  ```
  
  - *Type:* *bool
  
  True when ${} should be ommitted (because already inside them), false otherwise.
  
  ---
